contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} Engineer '''Francisco Escárcega Márquez''' (died 1938) was a builder of [[railroad]]s in [[Mexico]] and fought in the [[Mexican Revolution]]. He was born in [[Tlaxcala, Tlaxcala]], and opened up areas in southern and eastern Mexico with railways. The city and municipality of [[Escárcega]] in the state of [[Campeche]] are named after him. {{Persondata | NAME = Escarcega, Francisco | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1896 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1938 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Escarcega, Francisco}} [[Category:1896 births]] [[Category:1938 deaths]] [[Category:Mexican engineers]] [[Category:People of the Mexican Revolution]] [[Category:People from Tlaxcala, Tlaxcala]] [[Category:Victims of aviation accidents or incidents in Mexico]] [[Category:Mexican people in rail transportation]] {{Mexico-engineer-stub}} {{Rail-bio-stub}}
